metadata.title: CVE-2024-35845 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: wifi:iwlwifi: dbg-tlv: ensure NUL termination The iwl_fw_ini_debug_info_tlv isused as a string, so we must ensure the string is terminated correctlybefore using it.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-35845` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-1011-fips - 4.15.0-1011.12
linux-image-hmac-4.15.0-1011-fips - 4.15.0-1011.12
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1011-fips - 4.15.0-1011.12
linux-image-unsigned-hmac-4.15.0-1011-fips - 4.15.0-1011.12
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-2000-aws-fips - 4.15.0-2000.4
linux-image-unsigned-hmac-4.15.0-2000-aws-fips - 4.15.0-2000.4
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1002-azure-fips - 4.15.0-1002.2
linux-image-unsigned-hmac-4.15.0-1002-azure-fips - 4.15.0-1002.2
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1001-gcp-fips - 4.15.0-1001.1
linux-image-unsigned-hmac-4.15.0-1001-gcp-fips - 4.15.0-1001.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux-fips package in fips/bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1011.12').
linux-aws-fips package in fips/bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-2000.4').
linux-azure-fips package in fips/bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1002.2').
linux-gcp-fips package in fips/bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1001.1').
